N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M




                               Markscheme

                               November 2018


                                 Chemistry


                               Standard level


                                  Paper 3


25 pages

Baccalaureate and must not be reproduced or distributed to any
other person without the authorization of the IB Global Centre,
Cardiff.
                                                                        –3–                                            N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M



                                                                    Section A

     Question                              Answers                                                            Notes                              Total
1.     a        NO2/NO/NOx/HNO3/gas is poisonous/toxic/irritant ✔                  Accept formula or name.
                                                                                   Accept “HNO3 is corrosive” OR “poisonous/toxic gases
                                                                                   produced”.                                                     1
                                                                                   Accept “reaction is harmful/hazardous”.

1.     b        Slope (gradient):                                                                                                      1.00
                                                                                   Accept any correct relationship for slope such as         .
                40 ✔                                                                                                                   0.025


                Equation:                                                                                                                         2
                absorbance  40  concentration
                                                                                   Award [2] if equation in M2 is correct.
                OR
                y  40x ✔

1.     c        dilute 1.00 cm3 «of the standard solution with water» to 100 cm3   Accept any 1 : 100 ratio for M1.
                OR                                                                 Accept “mix 1 cm3 of the standard solution with 99 cm3 of
                                                                                   water” for M1.
                dilute sample of standard solution «with water» 100 times ✔
                                                                                   Do not accept “add 100 cm3 of water to 1.00 cm3 of
                                                                                   standard solution” for M1.                                     3
                «graduated/volumetric» pipette/pipet ✔                             Accept “burette/buret” for M2.
                volumetric flask ✔                                                 Accept “graduated/measuring flask” for M3 but not
                                                                                   “graduated/measuring cylinder” or “conical/Erlenmeyer
                                                                                   flask”.
                                                                       –4–                                         N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                                       Notes               Total
1.     d    i    concentration of copper  0.0080 «mol dm–3» ✔                                    Accept any value in range
                                                                                                  0.0075–0.0085 «mol dm–3» for M1.
                                                                                                  Accept annotation on graph for M1.
                 mass of copper in 250.0 cm3  «0.0080 mol dm–3  0.2500 dm3  63.55 g mol–1 »
                 0.127 «g»
                 OR
                 mass of brass in 1 dm3  «4  0.200 g » 0.800 g AND
                 [Cu2+] = «0.0080 mol dm–3  63.55 g mol–1 » 0.5084 g dm–3 ✔                                                             3


                                                       0.127
                 «% copper in this sample of brass           100 » 64 «%»
                                                       0.200
                                                                                                  Award [3] for correct final answer.
                 OR
                                                                                                  Accept “65 «%»”.
                                                     0.5084
                 «% copper in this sample of brass          100 » 64 «%» ✔
                                                     0.800

1.     d    ii   two ✔                                                                            Do not apply ECF from 1(d)(i).          1
                                                                          –5–                                           N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                           Answers                                                           Notes                     Total
1.     e    i    «since it is greater than 60%» it will reduce the presence of bacteria «on door
                 handles» ✔                                                                                                                          1


1.     e    ii   resistant to corrosion/oxidation/rusting                                                 Accept “hard/durable”, “«high tensile»
                 OR                                                                                       strength”, “unreactive”, “malleable” or
                                                                                                          any reference to the appearance/
                 low friction surface «so ideal for connected moving components» ✔                        colour of brass (eg “gold-like”, “looks
                                                                                                          nice” etc.).
                                                                                                                                                     1
                                                                                                          Do not accept irrelevant properties,
                                                                                                          such as “high melting/boiling point”,
                                                                                                          “non-magnetic”, “good heat/electrical
                                                                                                          conductor”, “low volatility”, etc.
                                                                                                          Do not accept “ductile”.

1.     f    i    2I– (aq) + 2Cu2+ (aq) + 2S2O32– (aq) → 2CuI (s) + S4O62– (aq)                            M2 can only be awarded if M1 is
                                                                                                          correct.                                   2
                 correct reactants and products ✔
                 balanced equation ✔

1.     f    ii   precipitate/copper(I) iodide/CuI makes colour change difficult to see
                 OR                                                                                                                                  1

                 release of I2/iodine from starch-I2 complex is slow so titration must be done slowly ✔
                                                                         –6–                                         N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


                                                                     Section B
Option A — Materials

      Question                                        Answers                                                        Notes                   Total
 2.     a          0.7 AND average   1.7 ✔                                                     Accept “EN” for “".


                 bonding between metallic and ionic                                                 Accept “bond is ionic but close to
                 OR                                                                                 several regions/several types/other
                                                                                                    named bonding type(s) (eg covalent,
                 more than one type of bonding present                                              metallic and covalent etc.)”.
                 OR                                                                                 Do not accept just “bond is ionic”.
                 bond type difficult to determine as close to several regions/several types/named                                             2
                 bonding types «eg ionic and covalent etc.»
                 OR
                 bond is mostly covalent «based on % covalent scale on diagram»
                 OR
                              0.7
                 bond has «        100 » 22% ionic character ✔                                    Accept any value for % ionic character
                              3.2
                                                                                                    in range 15–24% or % covalent
                                                                                                    character in range 76–85%.
                                                                      –7–                                       N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                           Answers                                                      Notes               Total
2.     b    i    Thermoplastic polymer:
                 PMA AND «weak» intermolecular/IMFs/London/dispersion/van der Walls/vdW/dipole-dipole    Do not accept “hydrogen
                 forces «between layers/chains»                                                          bonding” for M1.
                 OR
                 PMA AND no/few cross-links «between layers/chains» ✔
                                                                                                                                          2

                 Thermosetting polymer:                                                                  Award [1 max] for correct
                                                                                                         reasons for both polymer
                 Bakelite® AND «strong» covalent bonds «between layers/chains»                           classes even if named
                 OR                                                                                      polymers are incorrectly
                                                                                                         classified.
                 Bakelite® AND extensive cross-links «between layers/chains» ✔

2.     b    ii   CH2CHCl (s) + 2O2 (g)     HCl (g) + CO (g) + CO2 (g) + H2O (g)                          Accept any correctly balanced
                                                                                                         equation that includes the
                 OR
                                                                                                         products specified.              1
                 CH2CHCl (s) + O2 (g)     HCl (g) + 2CO (g) + H2O (g) AND 2CO (g) + O2 (g)   CO2 (g) ✔
                                                                         –8–                                        N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                       Notes                 Total
2.     c    i    pores/cavities/channels/holes/cage-like structures «in zeolites» have specific
                 shape/size ✔
                                                                                                                                           2
                 only reactants «with appropriate size/geometry» fit inside/go through/are
                 activated/can react ✔

2.     c    ii   does not require corrosive acid/«concentrated» sulfuric acid/H2SO4
                 OR
                 zeolite can be recycled «more easily»
                 OR
                 product can be «more» easily separated from a zeolite «than from sulfuric acid»                                           1
                 OR
                 minimal/less impact on environment
                 OR
                 synthesis of specific isomers as products ✔

2.     d         Name and reason:                                                                  Accept “PET/PETE AND peak for CO
                 PET/PETE AND peak for CO «at 1700–1750 cm–1» ✔                                   «at 1050–1410 cm–1»” for M1.
                                                                                                   Accept “PET/PETE AND peak(s) for
                                                                                                   COO” for M1.                            2
                 RIC:
                                                                                                   Accept name or abbreviation for
                 1✔                                                                                polymer.
                                                                                                   No ECF for M2.
                                                                         –9–                                    N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                    Answers                                                   Notes                      Total
3.     a        positive ions/cations/Pb2                                          Accept “ions” OR “charged species/particle”.
                OR                                                                                                                     1
                free electrons ✔

3.     b        [Pb2]  0.50  10‒6/5.0  10–7 «g dm–3» ✔
                            0.50  10 –6 g dm–3                                     Award [2] for correct final answer.                2
                [Pb2] «                       »  2.4  10‒9 «mol dm‒3» ✔
                             207.20 g mol–1

3.     c        «Faraday’s constant, F  9.65  104 C mol‒1 and 1 A  1 C s–1»
                Q « 0.0500 mol  2  96500 C mol‒1»  9650 «C» ✔
                                                                                                                                       2
                     Q    9650 C                    7200 s
                t «             –1
                                      7200 s so               »  2.00 «hours» ✔   Award [2] for correct final answer.
                     I   1.34 C s                60  60 s h–1
                                                                       – 10 –                                   N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                     Notes                     Total
4.     a        Any two of:
                cloudy/foggy/hazy phase «at first melting point» ✔
                clear liquid phase «at second melting point/higher temperature» ✔
                                                                                                                                          2 max

                two «different» melting points                                                 Accept “exhibit both liquid and solid
                                                                                               properties at the same time” for M3.
                OR
                new phase observed over a wide temperature range ✔

4.     b        ALTERNATIVE 1:
                «bulky/long» C5H11/R/alkyl «group/chain» AND prevents molecules from packing
                closer together «to form solid state» ✔
                                                                                                                                            1
                ALTERNATIVE 2:
                biphenyl «fragment»/two benzene rings/two aromatic rings AND «makes            Accept “rigid/rod-shaped molecule, so
                molecule» rigid/rod-shaped ✔                                                   aligns with other molecules” for
                                                                                               ALTERNATIVE 2.

4.     c        «average» oxidation state of C in C6H12/cyclohexane  –2 AND in CNTs  0       Accept “oxidation number” for “oxidation
                                                                                               state”.
                OR
                oxidation state of C in CNTs is higher than in C6H12/cyclohexane
                OR                                                                                                                          2
                loss of H’s/hydrogens ✔


                «oxidation at» anode/positive/ «electrode» ✔
                                                                         – 11 –                                    N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


Option B — Biochemistry

      Question                                        Answers                                                      Notes                    Total
 5.     a        catabolism «of food/nutrients»                                                  Accept “ATP” but not “burning of
                                                                                                 food/nutrients”.
                 OR                                                                                                                          1
                 «cellular» respiration ✔

 5.     b        not enough sunlight/UV light «for synthesis of vitamin D in the skin» ✔                                                     1

 5.     c        cannot be metabolized/broken down
                 OR
                 not biodegradable
                 OR                                                                                                                          2
                 accumulates in lipid/fat tissues ✔


                 increased concentration as one species feeds on another «in the food chain» ✔



 6.     a        hydrogen bonding ✔                                                              Accept a diagram which shows hydrogen
                                                                                                 bonding for M1 and which shows the
                                                                                                 interaction between O of C=O and H of NH
                 between C=O and H–N «groups» ✔                                                  groups for M2.                              2
                                                                                                 Accept “between amido/amide/
                                                                                                 carboxamide” but not “between
                                                                                                 amino/amine” for M2.
                                                                         – 12 –                                        N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                  Answers                                                         Notes                          Total
6.     b    i    Enzyme action:                                                        Accept “favourable orientation/conformation of the
                 Any two of:                                                           substrate «enforced by enzyme»” for M1.

                 substrate binds to active site ✔
                 weakens bonds in substrate ✔

                 lowers activation energy
                 OR
                 provides alternate pathway ✔

                 increases rate of reaction
                 OR
                 acts as catalyst ✔
                                                                                                                                              3 max
                 substrate specific ✔

                 Limitation:
                 Any one of:
                 temperature dependent ✔
                 pH dependent ✔
                 can be sensitive to heavy metal ions ✔
                 sensitive to denaturation ✔
                 can be inhibited ✔
                                                                                       Do not accept “substrate specific” as both an enzyme
                 substrate specific ✔
                                                                                       action and a limitation.
6.     b    ii   Any one of:
                 «increase rate of» hydrolyse/break down lipids/oils/fats/proteins ✔                                                          1 max
                 «wash at» lower temperature/consume less energy ✔
                                                                          – 13 –                                    N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M



     Question                                        Answers                                                      Notes                        Total
7.     a         phosphoric acid ✔                                                             Do not accept formulas.
                                                                                                                                                 2
                 glycerol/propane-1,2,3-triol ✔

7.     b    i    ALTERNATIVE 1:
                 4 C=C bonds/4 carbon to carbon double bonds ✔
                 mass of iodine per mole of acid  «4  253.80 g mol–1 » 1015.2 «g mol–1» ✔
                                                                                               Award [3] for correct final answer.
                                     1015.2 g mol–1
                 iodine number «                    100»  367 ✔
                                     276.46 g mol–1

                                                                                                                                                 3
                 ALTERNATIVE 2:
                 4 C=C bonds/4 carbon to carbon double bonds ✔
                         100 g
                 «                  × 4 =» 1.447 mol of I2 «reacts with 100 g» ✔
                     276.46 g mol–1
                 iodine number «= 1.447 mol × 253.80 g mol–1» = 367 ✔

7.     b    ii   Any two of:
                 «structural» components of cell membranes ✔                                   Accept other specific functions, such as
                                                                                               “prostaglandin/cytokine/bile acid synthesis”,
                 energy storage/utilization ✔                                                  “cell differentiation/growth”, “myelination”,
                                                                                               “storage of vitamins/biomolecules”, “signal     2 max
                 «thermal/electrical» insulation ✔
                                                                                               transmission”, “protection/padding of
                 transport «of lipid-soluble molecules» ✔                                      organs”, “precursors/starting materials for
                                                                                               the biosynthesis of other lipid”.
                 hormones/chemical messengers ✔
                                                                        – 14 –                                    N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                 Answers                                                     Notes                         Total
7.     c        Any one of:                                                      Accept “arteries become blocked/walls become
                                                                                 thicker”.
                atherosclerosis/cholesterol deposition «in artery walls» ✔
                                                                                                                                       1 max
                heart/cardiovascular disease ✔
                stroke ✔



8.     a        «1,4-»glycosidic ✔                                               Do not accept “glucosidic”.                             1

8.     b        H and OH are reversed/in different positions on C-4 ✔            C-4 must be specified.
                                                                                 Do not penalize if reference is made to H and OH
                                                                                                                                         1
                                                                                 above and below ring/in alpha and beta positions on
                                                                                 C-4 incorrectly.

Option C — Energy

      Question                                      Answers                                                  Notes                       Total
 9.     a         small/lighter nuclei combine to form larger/heavier nuclei ✔         Accept binding energy curve with explanation.
                                                                                                                                          2
                  product has higher binding energy «per nucleon» ✔

 9.     b    i    converts non-fissile «238U» material into fissile «239Pu» material
                  OR                                                                                                                      1

                  produces more fissile material than it consumes ✔

 9.     b    ii   239Pu    1n → 133Xe  103Zr  41n ✔                                 Accept equation with correct atomic numbers
                                                                                       included.
                                                                                       Accept notation for neutrons of “n”.               1
                                                                                       Accept a correctly described equation in words.

 9.     c         ALTERNATIVE 1:
                      240
                  «       » 8 t 1 /8 half-lives «required» ✔
                      30         2


                  % remaining  «0.508  100 » 0.39 «%» ✔                             Award [2] for correct final answer.

                                                                                                                                          2
                  ALTERNATIVE 2:
                          0.693
                  λ«           » 0.023 ✔
                            30
                  % remaining  «100  e–0.023  240 » 0.39 «%» ✔
                                                                     – 16 –                                        N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                             Answers                                                   Notes                    Total
10.   a        ALTERNATIVE 1:                                                                 Accept “3C (s)  2H2O (g) → CH4 (g)  2CO
               2C (s)  2H2O (g) → CH4 (g)  CO2 (g) ✔                                        (g)”.

                                                                                                                                           1
               ALTERNATIVE 2:
               C (s)  H2O (g) → CO (g)  H2 (g) AND 3H2 (g)  CO (g) → CH4 (g)  H2O (g) ✔

10.   b   i         891kJ mol–1                                                               Do not penalize negative sign.
               «                 » 55.5 «kJ g–1» ✔
                   16.05 g mol–1                                                              Do not accept energy density at STP/
                                                                                                                39.3                       1
                                                                                              density at STP         55.06 «kJ g–1».
                                                                                                               0.707

10.   b   ii    141.6                                                                         Accept “hydrogen/H2 produces «nearly»
               «      » hydrogen/H2 produces 2.6 times/more than twice the energy of          three times more energy than methane/CH4
                 55.5
               methane/CH4 «per mass/g»                                                       «per mass/g»”.
               OR
               less mass of hydrogen/H2 required «to produce same amount of energy»
                                                                                                                                           1
               OR
               hydrogen/H2 more energy efficient ✔




10.   c        moctane « 72.0 dm3  703 g dm–3»  50600 «g»/50.6 «kg» ✔                      Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                    8  44.01                                                                                              2
               mcarbon dioxide «              50.6»  156 «kg» ✔
                                     114.26
                                                                  – 17 –                                      N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M



  Question                                   Answers                                                     Notes                           Total
11.   a      Advantage:
             renewable «energy source»                                           Accept “can be used for passive/active heating”,
                                                                                 “can be converted to electric energy”.
             OR
                                                                                 Accept any specific greenhouse gas name or
             does not produce greenhouse gases                                   formula for “greenhouse gases”.
             OR
             can be installed «almost» anywhere
             OR
             low maintenance costs ✔


             Disadvantage:
             widely dispersed/not concentrated «form of energy»                  Accept “solar cells require large areas”, “solar cell
                                                                                 manufacture produces pollution/greenhouse
             OR
                                                                                 gases”, “higher cost of solar cells «compared with       2
             geography/weather/seasonal dependent                                traditional sources such as fossil fuels or
             OR                                                                  hydroelectric»”.

             not available at night
             OR
             energy storage is difficult/expensive
             OR
             toxic/hazardous materials used in production
             OR
             concerns about space/aesthetics/local environment where installed
             OR
             need to be «constantly» cleaned ✔
                                                                      – 18 –                                     N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                     Answers                                                        Notes                        Total
11.   b        B AND larger/more extensive «electronic» conjugation                    Accept more specific statements, such as
               OR                                                                      “sp3 carbon in A prevents conjugation between
                                                                                       aromatic rings”.                                     1
               B AND «contains» more alternate single and double bonds ✔

11.   c   i    high viscosity ✔                                                        Accept “low volatility”, just “viscous/viscosity”
                                                                                       OR “does not flow easily”.                           1

11.   c   ii   convert to esters of monoatomic alcohols                                Accept “convert to shorter «carbon chain»
                                                                                       esters” OR “transesterification”.
               OR
                                                                                                                                            1
                                                                                       Accept specific alcohols, such as methanol or
               react with short-chain alcohols «in the presence of acid or base» ✔
                                                                                       ethanol.

11.   d        carbon dioxide/CO2 more/most abundant «GHG than methane/CH4»            Accept “carbon dioxide/CO2 contributes more to
                                                                                       global warming «than methane/CH4»”.
               OR
               carbon dioxide/CO2 has «much» longer atmospheric life «than
               methane/CH4» ✔


               methane/CH4 «much» better/more effective at absorbing IR radiation
               «than carbon dioxide/CO2»                                                                                                    2
               OR
               methane/CH4 has a greater greenhouse factor «than carbon dioxide/CO2»
               OR
               methane/CH4 has a greater global warming potential/GWP «than
               carbon dioxide/CO2» ✔
                                                                     – 19 –                              N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                    Answers                                                 Notes                       Total
11.   e      CO2 (g) + H2O (l)  H+ (aq) + HCO3– (aq)                             Accept “H2CO3 (aq)” for “CO2 (aq) H2O (l)”.
             OR                                                                   Equilibrium arrows required for M1.
             CO2 (g)  CO2 (aq) AND CO2 (aq) + H2O (l)  H+ (aq) + HCO3– (aq) ✔   State symbols required for CO2 (g)  CO2 (aq)
                                                                                  equation only for M1.                            2
                                                                                  Accept “concentration of H+/[H+] increases
             «increasing [CO2 (g)]» shifts equilibrium/reaction to right AND pH   AND pH decreases” for M2.
             decreases ✔

Option D — Medicinal chemistry

    Question                                   Answers                                                          Notes                           Total
 12.   a                                              Bond angle
                 -lactam ring                90º ✔
                                              120º                                                                                               2
                 Expected bond angles          AND

                                              109.5º ✔                                  Accept “109º”.

 12.   b        «irreversibly» binds/bonds to enzyme/transpeptidase                     Accept “reacts with” for “bonds to” for M1.
                OR
                inhibits enzyme/transpeptidase «in bacteria» that produces cell walls   Do not accept “cell membrane” for “cell wall” for M1.
                OR
                prevents cross-linking of bacterial cell walls ✔                                                                                 2


                cells absorb water AND burst                                            Accept “cells burst due to osmotic pressure” for M2.
                OR                                                                      Accept “bacteria” for “cells” for M2.
                cells cannot reproduce ✔
                                                                     – 21 –                                  N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                 Answers                                                   Notes                         Total
12.   c      Any one of:                                                      Accept “superbugs such as MRSA develop” but
             leads to «bacterial» resistance «to antibiotics»                 superbug must be identified.

             OR
             makes antibiotics less effective                                 Accept “immune” for resistant but do not accept
                                                                              “tolerance”
             OR
             increased side effects due to larger dosages/over time ✔


             increases proportion of resistant bacteria ✔
                                                                                                                                  1 max

             destroys useful/beneficial bacteria
             OR
             destroyed bacteria replaced by more harmful bacteria ✔


             resistant bacteria pass on their mutation to next generation ✔


             damage to ecosystems ✔

12.   d      «modify» side-chain ✔                                            Accept “«modify» R”.                                  1

12.   e      no cell walls
             OR                                                                                                                     1
             humans do not have transpeptidase ✔
                                                                    – 22 –                                           N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M




  Question                                   Answers                                                            Notes                      Total
13.   a      blood-brain barrier is hydrophobic/non-polar/made of lipids ✔              Accept “fats” for “lipid”.
             morphine has hydroxyl/OH «groups»/is more polar AND diamorphine has        Accept “alcohol/hydroxy” for “hydroxyl” but not
                                                                                        “hydroxide”.                                        2
             ester/ethanoate/OCOCH3/acetate «groups»/is less polar/is lipid soluble ✔
                                                                                        Accept “non-polar” for “less polar” in M2.

13.   b      «temporarily» binds to «opioid» receptor sites in the brain/CNS
             OR                                                                                                                             1
             «temporarily» suppresses pain impulses in/to the brain/CNS ✔

13.   c      fraction/proportion/percentage of «administered dosage» enters             Accept “fraction/proportion/percentage of
             blood/plasma/circulation ✔                                                 «administered dosage» that reaches target           1
                                                                                        «part of human body»”.
                                                                            – 23 –                              N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                       Answers                                                   Notes                        Total
14.   a      ALTERNATIVE 1:
                                     [ A– ] 
             Using: pH  pK a  log         
                                     [HA] 
             pKa  10.32 ✔
                                0.0200                                             Award [2] for correct final answer.
             pH  «10.32  log          » 10.62 ✔
                                0.0100 
                                                                                                                                         2

             ALTERNATIVE 2:
                           0.0100 
             [H] « Ka           »  2.4  1011 ✔
                           0.0200 
                                                                                     Accept answers for M2 between 10.6 and 10.7.
             pH  10.62 ✔
                                                                                     Award [1 max] for pH  10.02.

14.   b      CaCO3 (s)  2HCl (aq)  CaCl2 (aq)  H2O (l)  CO2 (g)
             OR                                                                                                                          1
             CaCO3 (s)  2H (aq) 
                                
                                        Ca2 (aq)    H2O (l)  CO2 (g) ✔

14.   c      «back» titration                                                        Accept “gravimetric analysis”.
             OR                                                                      Do not accept description of a technique without
             thermal decomposition                                                   proper term given for the technique.
                                                                                                                                         1
             OR
             atomic absorption/AA ✔
                                                                      – 24 –                                       N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                             Answers                                                        Notes                   Total
15.   a      bacteria perform living functions «on their own and viruses do not without host cell»     Accept “bacteria have flagella/
             OR                                                                                        cytoplasm/ribosome «and virus
                                                                                                       can have head/protein tail/double
             bacteria have cell walls «and viruses do not»                                             stranded RNA/single stranded
             OR                                                                                        DNA»”, “asexual reproduction for
                                                                                                       bacteria”, other specific structural
             bacteria do not have a capsid «and viruses do»                                            differences between bacteria and
             OR                                                                                        viruses, and examples of living          1
                                                                                                       functions that bacteria perform
             bacteria larger than viruses                                                              (such as excretion, reproduction
             OR                                                                                        etc.) that viruses do not.
             bacteria reproduce by fission/budding «and viruses reproduce within a living host cell»
             OR
             bacteria affected by antibiotics «while viruses are not» ✔

15.   b      Any two of:
             prevents virus attaching to host cell ✔                                                   Accept “prevents synthesis of virus
                                                                                                       by host cell”.
             alters cell’s genetic material/DNA «so that virus cannot use it to multiply» ✔
                                                                                                       Accept “alters RNA/DNA/genetic
             blocks enzyme activity in the host cell «so that virus cannot use it to multiply» ✔       material of virus”.                    2 max
             prevents removal of protein coat/capsid ✔                                                 Do not accept just “mimics
                                                                                                       nucleotides”.
             prevents injection of viral DNA/RNA into cell ✔
             prevents release of «replicated» viruses from host cell ✔
                                                          – 25 –                    N18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                     Answers                              Notes                     Total
16.          Any two of:
             «weak» C–Cl bonds break/produce radicals ✔
             contribute to ozone depletion ✔
             contribute to «photochemical» smog ✔
                                                                                                              2 max
             cause cancers ✔
             damage respiratory system ✔
             cause organ failure ✔
             produce toxic chemicals/phosgene/dioxins ✔            Accept “chlorinated solvents are toxic”.
